item.title: Research Interests
item.description: I am a doctoral student using the Language Environment Analysis System (LENA) to study how parent-child interactions influence the development of language and executive functioning over time. I am particularly interested in the language and strategies parents use to guide their children through “everyday tasks” like grooming, mealtime, and book-reading – things that can be challenging for a young child. I am interested in applying this research to practical, large-scale interventions targeting early childhood settings and parenting practices.

HEATHER ANDERSON HeatherA@uoregon.edu htanderson.github.io -- EDUCATION // Doctoral Student, Psychology, 2017-present University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) Advisor: Dr. Caitlin Fausey Bachelor of Arts, 2005-2010 University of California, Berkeley Majors: Psychology & Integrative Biology Research Experience // Graduate Student Researcher, University of Oregon 2017-present Learning Laboratory Principal Investigator: Caitlin M. Fausey, Ph.D. Project Auditory Environments of Infants and Toddlers (Eugene, OR) 2017-present Corpus of daylong audio collected from infants and toddlers ages 3-12 months.
